comment: she is so sweet but take almost the whole semester to grade things. You have to work for that A for sure. Its all group work that it preassigned, no exams

Overall pretty run of the mill 4 week summer course, but beware, she does check the time you spend on D2L! I believe its the same metric you can see if you go into d2l and go to (other) -> (class progress). But it does seem like she actually likes talking about mHealth.

Dr Tatro is super sweet, empathetic, and understanding, though like the rest of the reviews.. she waited til the last day to put grades in. Its one big group project that you get to pick the topic of and then you present it during the midterm and then final.

Dr.Tatro is a great person, but waiting until the LAST MINUTE to post grades is not fair to us as students. She put in one grade from January and didn't put in anymore grades until after spring break. I appreciate the detailed feedback, but the harsh grading is unnecessary if we don't have it prior to the following assignment on the same topic.

Professor Tatro was a really sweet she knows a lot and is helpful when you need it. BUT it is all group work and if you get stuck with a bad group like I did it makes the class almost impossible to finish strongly. She takes all semester to put in grades and grades hard. everything is with the same group from day one. find someone else pls

She is very kind and attentive; however, this 'course' is just a big group project. The lecture portion of class is not engaging, and the second half is spent doing different worksheets, rephrasing the same material you and your group have discussed all semester. I believe this class has the potential to be enjoyable, but honestly, not as is.

Group work felt like a way for the professor to avoid teaching or grading. She provided little guidance, rarely gave feedback on time, and seemed disengaged. The group format didn't enhance learning—just shifted the workload. Take with someone else if you can.

Poorly organized lectures, unclear assignment instructions, and weeks-late feedback made this class extremely frustrating. The professor seemed unprepared and offered little support. If possible, take this course with someone else, or avoid it altogether. Second-worst class in the Wellstar program.

Personally, this professor is very sweet and polite. Shes is invested in what she does. She goes thorugh lectures very fast!
This class has many assignments and projects with directions that are not clear. Assignments are very in depth, often  and lengthy! 
Each assignment is weighty, This leaves you with no room for error.  Take alternative class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Tatro is an amazing professor and truly cares about her students. This class had LOTS of group work. The only negative about her is she takes forever to grade things. The whole semester, you work on a project about a health issue of your choosing, and she works with you to make sure you succeed. She also gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy
